titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the Daisy Annita Rice Botanical Specimen Album
circa 1908
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Eva Guggemos

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2012-03-29

did.unittitle: Daisy Annita Rice Botanical Specimen Album
did.abstract: Daisy Annita Rice was a high school and music conservatory student at Tualatin Academy in Forest Grove, Oregon, around 1905-1909. The album contains of pressed flowers and other plants, which she probably collected for a class there.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Daisy Annita Rice was a high school and music conservatory student at Tualatin Academy in Forest Grove, Oregon, around 1905-1909. She was originally from Clatskanie. Tualatin Academy was the college preparatory school that was attached to Pacific University. She likely attended a class there given by Charles Oscar Chambers, a professor of biology who taught a course on the botany of flowers.

prefercite.p: Daisy Annita Rice Botanical Specimen Album, Pacific University Archives, Forest Grove, Oregon.

scopecontent.p: The album contains of pressed flowers and other plants that were collected and labelled by Daisy Anitta Rice, probably for a high school class at Tualatin Academy in Forest Grove, Oregon. The album was donated to Pacific University by Rena Watten of Tygh Valley.
